We launched today a global award for Arabic language .. Our goal is to serve the language of the Quran and to enable it and spread it .. And ask God help http://t.co/WBVxZlUUCY

We will recognize in the Arab Language Award the exceptional contributions and distinguished experiences in the service of the Arabic language, and our goal is to publish these successful models and build upon them
The Arabic Language Award will recognize the best experiences in language education for new generations, as well as the best media programs and smart applications for publishing

We will also honor the Arab Language Award for the best initiatives in the field of translation and Arabization, and the best initiatives in preserving, documenting and publishing Arab linguistic heritage

The language of evil is reserved by God, and its service is our honor, and the honor of its pioneers is our duty, and its protection is the protection of our thought, identity and culture http://t.co/WxblviVwcR

Georgia-Turkey-Azerbaijan trilateral cooperation is of great importance not only for our countries, but also for the region and the world.
Because our cooperation is based on common interests.
Our joint projects are beyond the regional context and have a global meaning.
The main outcome of the summit is that today, Georgia, Turkey and Azerbaijan trilateral format (cont) http://t.co/1WtBBi33G5
Georgia, Turkey and Azerbaijan on the basis of equal, mutual interest and mutual respect, (cont) http://t.co/iVG2AHbd0T
Baku-Tbilisi-Ceyhan, Baku-Tbilisi-Erzurum, Baku-Tbilisi-Kars projects have already been removed from the regional context (cont) http://t.co/XDIhX7SChz
The construction of the Shah-Deniz-2, Trans-Anatolian and Trans-Adriatic gas pipelines is one of Europe's largest infrastructure projects.
As a result of these projects, tens of thousands of new jobs will be created, business opportunities will be created.
Our countries will have even greater meaning for foreign investment. It is in the interest of every country.
All our initiatives are based on the will of our peoples and strong political will.

Watch the press conference #EUJapan summit 2014 with @AbeShinzo and @euHvR online, about to start at http://t.co/xVnJTWm5sw
Last year, #EUJapan launched negotiations for 2 important agreements: a Strategic Partnership Agreement & a Free Trade Agreement (1/2)
If one-year review of FTA allows, we must raise the ambition level & bring negotiations to a speedy & successful conclusion. #EUJapan (2/2)
Enhanced #EUJapan security partnership: we identified very concrete areas for cooperation; joint support to our African partners.
On #Ukraine: We call for diplomatic resolution of crisis. EU & Japan will continue to coordinate position within #G7, also on sanctions.
Further steps in destabilising #Ukraine will call for additional sanctions. The EU is ready to take decisions, if needed.
#Korea: grave concern EU about further development of #DPRK nuclear weapons & ballistic missile programmes and its human rights situation.
#EUJapan summit was testimony that #Japan and #EU are committed to expand & strengthen their partnership
Stressed urgency to act on #climatechange, #EUJapan recognised deep cuts in global greenhouse gas emission by all parties must be made
Together we account for close to 27% of global GDP: shared responsibility for global #growth, job creation&competitiveness #EUJapan

Prime Minister Antonis Samaras speech on Constitutional Review - Reforms https://t.co/dPe3VmLHGD
I feel that it is my duty, before leaving the office of @EU_Commission President, to share my experience and my thinking. #FutureofEurope
We have been building the much closer union that, before, was only an aspiration. Bureaucratic & diplomatic deliberation will no longer do.
Now is the time to debate on how far and how deep we want integration to go; on who wants to participate in what; and for what purpose.
(1) The challenges ahead of us in this phase of #European integration must be examined from the point of view of:
(2)  first, the politics needed; second, the policies needed, and third, the polity needed to achieve the first two. In that order.
Any further development of the Union should be based on the existing treaties and on the Community method.
